name: Bhimashankar Trek
difficulty: Moderate to Difficult (via Shidi Ghat/Ganesh Ghat)
duration: 3.5-4 hours (one way, Shidi Ghat); 5-7 hours (one way, Ganesh Ghat)
description: Bhimashankar Trek is a popular Sahyadri trail leading to the Bhimashankar Jyotirlinga temple, set amidst thick forest and abundant wildlife. There are two principal routes: the adventurous Shidi (ladder) Ghat and the longer, gentler Ganesh Ghat. The trek is famous for misty valleys, cloud forests, rare Giant Squirrel sightings, and historic ladders bolted onto cliffs. Ideal post-monsoon until early spring.

startingPoint.name: Khandas Village (base for both routes)
startingPoint.description: Khandas (near Karjat) is the start for both Shidi Ghat and Ganesh Ghat. Locals offer food, guiding, and camping on advance request.

networkAvailability.emergencyContact: 108 (ambulance), 112 (any emergency); inform Khandas village before trek

foodOptions: No food stalls after base; carry your own packed food

facilities: Restaurants and stalls near Bhimashankar temple (limited early morning/late evening)
recommendations: Multiple stalls for hot poha, tea, full meal (temple area)

locations: Khandas village (open ground, tents by villagers)
Near Hanuman temple (just outside forest border)
facilities: Local tent rental with mat, blanket
camping.cost: ₹800–1,200 per person (tent + meals; varies by season)

permits.forestDepartment: Not required for trek; temple entry open to all.
permits.entry: Free for trek, ₹50-100 for parking, camera tickets at temple (as applicable)
permits.timings: Open sunrise to sunset; forest gate sometimes closed in dark for solo travelers

safety.riskLevel: Moderate to High (monsoon and for Shidi Ghat ladder sections)
commonRisks: Slippery ladders, steep rock faces (Shidi Ghat)
Wildlife (snakes, insects; rare leopard in forest)
precautions: Carry rain gear and first aid

monsoon.conditions: Heavy rain, waterfalls, slippery ladders, thick fog
monsoon.recommendation: Only for experienced/fit trekkers; avoid solo. Check with Khandas locals about ladder condition beforehand.

winter.conditions: Cool, mistless, crisp air, clear trails

summer.conditions: Hot afternoons, little shade in lower stretches
summer.recommendation: Early morning start advised; carry extra water

trekRoute.totalDistance: Shidi Ghat: 8 km (one way); Ganesh Ghat: 13-15 km (one way)
trekRoute.difficulty: Moderate (Ganesh Ghat), Moderate-Difficult (Shidi Ghat, especially in rain)

waypoints.name: Shidi Ghat Junction
waypoints.description: Start of ladder climb (becomes river crossing in monsoon)

waypoints.name: Ganesh Ghat Forest Stretch
waypoints.description: Longer, less steep but exposed to sun/forest

waypoints.name: Bhimashankar Plateau
waypoints.description: Temple, canteen, housing, and local market

byTrain.description: Central Line local train to Karjat, then shared jeep/autos to Khandas
byTrain.distance: 90 km to Karjat; another 37 km by road
steps: Train from Mumbai CST/Dadar to Karjat

byBus.description: ST bus from Mumbai to Karjat, then to Kashele/Khandas
steps: Change to Kashele bus, then auto to Khandas

byPrivateVehicle.description: Drive via Mumbai–Pune Expressway to Karjat then to Khandas
steps: Drive Mumbai-CST/LTT to Karjat via Panvel
Follow Kashele road, signage to Khandas, parking at village

byTrain.description: Train to Karjat; local transport to Khandas

steps: Change to Kashele bus, then auto to Khandas

byPrivateVehicle.description: Drive via Lonavala and Karjat to Khandas
steps: Exit to Karjat road, onward to Khandas

bestTimeToVisit: October to February (post-monsoon, clear skies, minimal crowds)
